brief_description: Flow cytometry was used to measure the expression of IL2, IFN gamma and TNF alpha in CD8+ peripheral blood mononuclear cells isolated from healthy naive donors following stimulation with whole virus.
brief_title: CD8+ T cell immunity to 2009 pandemic and seasonal H1N1 influenza viruses
condition_studied: healthy naive donor PBMCs stimulated with whole influenza virus
description: Flow cytometry was used to measure the expression of IL2, IFN gamma and TNF alpha in CD8+ peripheral blood mononuclear cells isolated from 12 pH1N1 naive, healthy donors were stimulated in vitro with A/California/04/09 (pH1N1 strain, egg-grown), A/New Caledonia/20/09 (sH1N1, egg-grown), X31 (A/Puerto Rico H1N1 internal proteins, A/Hong Kong.
endpoints: Expression of IL2, IFN gamma and TNF alpha in CD8+ peripheral blood mononuclear cells
hypothesis: Healthy adults without prior exposure to pH1N1 will have pre-existing pH1N1-responsive CD8+ T cells as a result of previous exposure to sH1N1
objectives: Healthy adults without prior exposure to pH1N1 will have pre-existing pH1N1-responsive CD8+ T cells as a result of previous exposure to sH1N1
official_title: CD8+ T cell immunity to 2009 pandemic and seasonal H1N1 influenza viruses

arm.description: Healthy adults with ages 18-50 with informed consent and biosafety committee approval
arm.name: FCM_Cohort

personnel.organization: New York Influenza Center of Excellence
personnel.site_name: New York Influenza Center of Excellence

pubmed.title: CD8+ T cell immunity to 2009 pandemic and seasonal H1N1 influenza viruses.

program.program_name: NIAID Centers of Excellence for Influenza Research and Surveillance (CEIRS)
program.contract_name: New York Influenza Center of Excellence
